column4: hello, I wish to set up a 1gb ram disk, can someone help me understand what these commands do?
ramdisk? why are you making ext3 on it?
read about Linux  tmpfs & ramfs  infrastructure
OR, by default configuration, there is "ramdisk" of 50% of you total ram on /dev/shm
if i got 12GB, i would load my whole system into ram on boot :P
it takes 25 seconds to load 1GB of stuff from hard disk to ram.  but < 1 second from ram to ram
that would result in instant application startup
that's why i put it in /mnt/tmp
type "mount" command, if it shows something like /mnt/tmp mounted on tmpfs. it is
that uses dynamic allocation mechanism, and that the used memory goes into cache
between, i bind /tmp  to /dev/shm (which is a ramdisk in your terminology)    /tmp is the place where most UNIX applications store temporary files
